title: 107_hr646
content: The "Federal Communications Commission Reform Act" establishes a Commission to study and report on the organizational structure of the Federal Communications Commission, focusing on potential changes to reflect the current state of telecommunications and the possibility of reducing the number of commissioners. The Commission, composed of 7 members, is appointed by various leaders in consultation with relevant committees. The Commission, composed of 7 members, is appointed by representatives acting jointly. Appointments must be made within 45 days of the Act's enactment. Former FCC commissioners must be appointed. Members serve for life and vacancies are filled in the same manner as the original appointment. Members receive no pay but are reimbursed for travel expenses. The Commission, consisting of 7 members appointed by representatives, must adhere to expense regulations under applicable provisions. 4 members form a quorum for hearings. The Commission, consisting of 7 members appointed by representatives, must adhere to expense regulations under applicable provisions. 4 members form a quorum for hearings. SEC. 5. POWERS OF COMMISSION. The Commission, with 7 members appointed by representatives, can hold hearings, take testimony, and obtain necessary information from US departments to carry out the Act. Members and agents can take actions authorized by the Commission. The Federal Communications Commission can request information from government departments, conduct interviews with commissioners, accept gifts for its work, use the U.S. mails, and receive administrative support services from the Administrator of General Services. The Commission can receive administrative support services from the Administrator of General Services, request assistance from the Comptroller General of the United States, and contract with government and private agencies for supplies and services. The Commission will submit a report to Congress within 6 months of the Act's enactment, and upon doing so, the Commission will terminate.
